intro: Lappula ferganensis, commonly known as the Fergana lappia, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Camelotaceae and is characterized by its distinctive lobed leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in rocky soils. It has a short life cycle and is adapted to survive in harsh climatic conditions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in its native range.
